title: Crafting the Client: Profile and Collection

replies.body: Please add owned skins to the collection

Thanks for the suggestion. We're still looking at all the things we want to do during the alpha, and beyond.

Hi Davidroo! The plan is that you will indeed be able to check out your owned -- and unowned -- skins via your Collection.  Be sure to test out & give us feedback when that functionality becomes available (which will occur a bit later during the "Profile and Collection" phase of development).

I generally love it, however I have noticed no mention of the item sets. Are they being removed from the game?

Hi Legendsofthedark, Item sets currently doesn't really deliver on how we'd like to manage in game item sets.  It's kind of cumbersome to use, it's difficult to create builds for different combinations of maps, roles, and champions  and in many cases just isn't really used very much.  Instead of recreating item sets as they currently exist we're much more interested in exploring new ways for how players manage and take things into game with them.

What are some of the ways/things you'd like to be able to setup? Item sets? Runes/Masteries? Spells?

Regards!
ABV
Would you guys ever consider integrating something like Championify, which takes the most popular builds (using Champion.gg) on each champion and automagically makes items sets that way?
I agree on this. If you think it's  cumbersome, at least allow apps like Championify to do it automatically!

This won't affect those kinds of programs since they don't actually create a viewable item set in your profile.  So those programs should still work no problem while we sort out some of the other aspects of it.

I would like to be able to modify rune pages just like I do Mastery pages in champ select.  For some champs I use very slightly different rune setups and it would be better to not have individual rune pages for them.

Pleeeeeeeeeeease keep item sets in some way. I completely agree with you that the current setup isn't good (map variances are a big deal, so I personally just don't use any outside of SR), but item sets feel so essential to me. I find them such a huge time-saver and they really organise my mind in-game ("OK all my trinket options are here, which do I want right now?"). They're particularly useful if you build a champion in a way rather different from what's recommended - I build Eilse quite a bit squishier than the recommended tab says I should, so if it weren't for my item sets I'd need to spend lots of time searching the items I want.

I really like the new client so far (you guys are really amazing, I'm so impressed) but I'd be really quite upset if I couldn't make item sets anymore - while stuff like the champion profile pages being made prettier and more informative is *nice*, item sets are something I find hugely useful in a practical sense and that would suck hugely to lose :(

Something that has always bothered me is the Summoner Spell description pages currently do not list the COOLDOWN of those spells, and the new updated one does not either.  Can we please include the base cooldown of the summoner spells in their descriptions so that it's easier to make an informed decision on say, Barrier vs. Heal, or just to be able to plan how often your Ignite will be available?  This information shouldn't require third party sites or playing a custom match to find out.

Another neat stat would be total damage dealth, just to see how insane it is. And right now, I have to go to a third party app to see my hours logged, that would be a cool thing to see.

I'm not sure how well it might be accepted but what would you guys think if rune pages where part of the champions tab? For each champion you have unlocked you can further unlock a rune page attached to them, including each having their own mastery page of course.

 I feel this would feel cleaner than just having a bunch of random generalized rune pages and masteries in a list and instead you have access to specific masteries and runes by clicking on the champion you are going to play. I often switch roles a lot and never really stick to just one lane so having so many different types of masteries and rune pages crammed in a single list can be confusing even if you can name them.

In my opinion, this way champions will also feel more personal and more customisable. I suppose if it isn't an attractive idea to some you can also make it optional? Have a separate rune and mastery tab but have to option to attach them to champions so that they would only show when in champion select. Mind you it would also allow us to have greater number of 20 mastery pages and runes without having absurdly long drop menu.
Idea with big videos is awesome! :)

If a specific champion bio brings (visible) information relating to another champion, any way we can add in-client hotlinks to that champions Bio?

Reasons I thought it would be cool is it'd make the exploration an adventure, instead of a "IOT" multiple tabs feel.
IE: Read Sivir's bio, notice azir, click out of sivir then click into azir feel less of an adventure as to say => Read sivir's bio, notice azir and a highlight and be like... hmmmm o_o *click* "Oh snap it's referring to azir". 

Could this be a thing? Or more importantly, how does this thing sound, have you thought about something like this before, what were your thoughts?
